item.title: The Mural Project ‚Äì A gift for my wife
item.description:
I‚Äôve done very little writing on my weblog, except for some brief PDC promotional fodder.¬†¬† I‚Äôve had very lttle time as I‚Äôve been one of the guys driving logistics around the PDC, specifically around community.¬† With a week to the event, we‚Äôre in crunch mode.¬†¬†

During these times one thing that never ceases to amaze me is my wife‚Äôs attitude.¬† There‚Äôs never a complaint about my crazy hours and she makes sure that I can focus by just making sure that things get done at home.¬† Heck, I am still uncertain as to how she puts up with my fascination with having to have the latest gadgets, let alone my nutso schedule.¬† But she just does it!¬† Working at Microsoft has changed my life for the better in so many ways.¬†¬† To be honest though there is no way I could do the things that I do or be where I am wtihout my wife.

For her birthday this year I got her something special.¬† We have a blank wall in our dining room that is very bland.¬† Lauri wanted to spice it up and give it a bit of funk.¬† Maybe with some sort of painting.¬† We‚Äôve always been a fan of Italian scenes and artwork so that is where we started.

Last summer by chance we met a chalk artist drawing a very cool Italian scene on the sidewalk out in front of Bellevue Square.¬† We began to chat, exchanged contact information and my wife‚Äôs birthday present began to take shape.¬†¬†

What would it be like if we brought that chalk drawing from that day into a painted mural for our dining room?

Here‚Äôs the wall we‚Äôre changing‚Ä¶

(The cutie posing above is Josie.   My wife calls here Jeff in a dress) To give the mural depth and perspective we’ll be wrapping it around our stairs.

That‚Äôs giggles the bear and also our daughter‚Äôs pretend Pocket PC (Shh.. Don‚Äôt tell her its a gameboy she uses it to plan her day just like Dad).

The artist started yesterday.¬† This is her first major commercial project, it is exciting to watch someone start a business.¬† You can see the excitement in her and she works out every detail and the passion behind her.¬†¬† Now this is why I love small busineses üôÇ¬† Watching people with entrepreneurial spirit building a something out of nothing just by using their skills and passions.¬† That‚Äôs America baby!

Yesterday Jodie (the artist) brought over her sketches of what the wall will look like, so I scanned them in.¬† The first is the main wall.

The tall rectangular white spot is the entry to the hallway and the one at the top left are the ledges next to our stairwell.¬†¬† The mural will wrap around the wall and rise along the stairs.¬†

This picture shows the wall to the right of the stairwell and how it will be incorporated into the ledges.

Yesterday Jodie got most of the pencil work done and will return today to begin painting.¬† I‚Äôm trying to think of some easter eggs that we can have Jodie sneak into the finer details of the drawing (hidden items on the shelves, that relate to family experiences.)¬†but am at a loss for what to do.

This is just a bit of what‚Äôs happenign in my personal life.¬† I need to build up some BlogKharma after this Blog was starting to resemble a PDC Promotional Toy.¬†

I promise that once the PDC is over more of these types of posts will continue.

Happy Birthday Lauri üôÇ
-Jeff

item.title: Skor Toffee Squares Recipe
item.description:
Recipe Time!

My mom tuned me into this recipe last time she was down visiting and I had to share.¬†¬† Sorry, but I¬†don‚Äôt know who to credit this recipe to, but it is quick, fun and tastey.¬† I did some Google Recipe hunting this morning and found the precise ingredients, even better they had the key ingredient at Safeway.¬†¬†

Let me know if you try it.
**
Skor Toffee Squares**
1 ‚Äì Package of SKOR bar chips (made by ChipIts)
1 ‚Äì Box of Ritz Crackers, crushed
1 ‚Äì Can of Sweetened Condensed Milk

Crush Ritz crackers with rolling pin (if you leave them in the bag it is less messy). Add the can of milk, and all but 1/4 cup of the SKOR ChipIts. Mix all ingredients and press into an 8√ó8 well greased pan.

Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, sprinkle the remaining ChipIts, let it cool and enjoy!

I love using Google to hunt for recipes.

item.title: How do I use my Tablet while at my desk?
item.description:
I love my Toshiba Portege 3500 Tablet PC.¬†¬† It is beefy enough to run Visual Studio, has a decent battery life and a good size screen.¬†¬†

In my office though I still use a desktop PC for my day to day work.¬† I wanted a way to use the tablet also for running my news aggregator , viewing my schedule, while still using my monitor for my main PC.¬†¬†¬†¬†

Here is what I did:

1.¬† I went to my friendly neighborhood Target¬†and got a desktop picture frame holder that was strong enough to hold up my Tablet PC in portrait mode.

2.¬† I installed ShareKMC¬†on both my Desktop and Tablet PC.

With ShareKMC and simple press of the pause key I can switch control to my Tablet PC from the Desktop over the local area network.¬† I can copy and paste text and small images between the two machines.¬† The mouse pointer is a little jerky (hopefully its fixed in the final release) , but the keyboard works great.¬†¬†

I can keep my schedule up while leaving my monitor for real work.¬† If I need to swap over to the tablet and type or dismiss a meeting request I can do so easily.¬†

Thanks Scoble for the photo.

item.title: Roxio to acquire PressPlay

I have for the past few months been enjoying my subscription to PressPlay.¬†¬† I take great interest in today‚Äôs news that Roxio has acquired PressPlay.¬†¬† It will be fun watching Roxio relaunch the¬†Napster service.
